data.text:
Hiroyuki Kobayashi (小林 裕幸, Kobayashi Hiroyuki?, born August 12, 1972 in Nagoya, Japan[1]) is a Japanese video game and television anime producer and supervisor. He is employed by Capcom.[1]

Works[]

Kobayashi studied computer science at Chukyo University. After graduating, he was hired at Capcom in 1995 as a programmer on the first Resident Evil game.[1] At the time Resident Evil was largely completed, having already transitioned towards pre-rendered backgrounds.[2] After working as programmer on the sequel and a planner on the first Dino Crisis game, his first producer role was on Dino Crisis 2 in 2000.[1]

Starting with the first Sengoku Basara game (titled Devil Kings in North America) in 2005, Kobayashi worked as the producer for the video game series as well as a planning supervisor for the various anime adaptations. He was very interested in the Sengoku period and wanted to create an action game inspired by that period.[3]

On March 31, 2022, Kobayashi had left Capcom as an producer and announced his departure via an tweet on August 12, 2022, with his intention of joining NetEase Games as an producer after his 27 years long of contribution.

Video games[]

Kobayashi has worked on a number of video games, including the following (dates given are for the Japanese release). Credits are for producer unless otherwise indicated.

Resident Evil (programmer, 1996)

Resident Evil 2 (programmer, 1998)

Dino Crisis (planner, 1999)

Dino Crisis 2 (2000)

Devil May Cry (programmer, 2001)

Resident Evil (producer, 2002)

Resident Evil 0 (promotional producer, 2002)

P.N.03 (2003)

Resident Evil 4 (producer, 2005)[4]

Killer7 (2005)

Sengoku Basara (2005)

Sengoku Basara 2 (2006)

Sengoku Basara 2 Heroes (2007)

Devil May Cry 4 (producer, 2008)

Sengoku Basara X (2008)

Sengoku Basara: Battle Heroes (2009)

Sengoku Basara: Samurai Heroes (2010)

Sengoku Basara Chronicle Heroes (2011)

Dragon's Dogma (producer, 2012)

Resident Evil 6 (executive producer, 2012)

Anime[]

Kobayashi has also worked on several anime series.

Devil May Cry: The Animated Series (TV anime, supervisor, 2007)

Resident Evil: Degeneration (CG anime film, producer, story, 2008)

Sengoku Basara: Samurai Kings (TV anime, planning supervisor, 2009)

Sengoku Basara II (TV anime, planning supervisor, 2010)

Sengoku Basara: The Last Party (anime film, planning supervisor, 2011)

Resident Evil: Damnation (CG anime film, producer, 2012)

Resident Evil: Vendetta (CG anime film, supervisor, 2017)

Resident Evil: Infinite Darkness (CG TV anime, executive producer, 2021)

Resident Evil: Death Island (CG anime film, original supervisor, special thanks, 2023)
